body: @asyms right. I'm going to write a summary function that will display the previous output for the new code.

@philipperemy is the summary display the only thing that's different tho? The problem I'm having is that I have models trained with the old setup, and can't load them in the new setup. I thought it had something to do with the above stated summary difference aswell.
@asyms yeah I fear that the checkpoints can be somehow incompatible from 2.8.x to 2.9.x. We did a big refactoring to make it Keras compliant to prepare for the merge in the Tensorflow addons library.

Is there any way I can get the old layer structure in 2.9.x? I've tried adapting the tcn library but withouth success.
Also a (kind of) related question: Were any architectural changes made from 2.8.x to 2.9.x? As can be seen from the model above there seems to not be an activation function after the last res block (after add_5)?
@psomers3 can you confirm this `As can be seen from the model above there seems to not be an activation function after the last res block (after add_5)`? Thanks!!

@philipperemy Thanks for the follow up.

I don't really care about the summary, all I want is to be able to load the models trained with the old structure in the new structure, which is not the case right now. Loading the weights using model.load_weights(model_path, by_name=True) doesn't actually give an error, but don't load the correct weights. 

I came across this issue: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/28154
Maybe implementing a similar Module class (the one commented in his code snippet) could be a solution?

@philipperemy There is indeed no activation on the last residual block in both the old version and the new. I just implemented it directly without considering it, but I suppose we should probably fix that.

issue.title: model.summary without detail of each layer in tcn
issue.body:
Hi, philipperemy 
Thanks for you work! Model.summary without detail of each layer in tcn block. As we know tcn include dilated convolutions and skip connect and so on, but we can not see the detail, likes output shape, parameter for each layer inside tcn. Do you know any ways to show it ? 


Any reply/advice will be much appreciated!

body: @asyms can you upgrade by `keras-tcn==3.0.2` and use this function: https://github.com/philipperemy/keras-tcn/pull/128#issue-398690349? You'll be able to compare the two versions.
Going to close this issue for inactivity.
